1.brief: gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative

properly, a verdict (favorable or unfavorable) pronounced judicially, especially a sentence or formal decree (human or (participant's) divine law, individual or collective), including the act, the place, the suit, the crime, and the penalty; abstractly, justice, including a participant's right or privilege (statutory or customary), or even a style
to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
rightness (abstractly), subjectively (rectitude), objectively (justice), morally (virtue) or figuratively (prosperity)
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)

2.brief: a straight course, i.e. sail direct
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
the right (natural, moral or legal); also (abstractly) equity or (figuratively) prosperity

properly, a verdict (favorable or unfavorable) pronounced judicially, especially a sentence or formal decree (human or (participant's) divine law, individual or collective), including the act, the place, the suit, the crime, and the penalty; abstractly, justice, including a participant's right or privilege (statutory or customary), or even a style

3.brief: to lift, in a great variety of applications, literal and figurative, absolute and relative
a mountain or range of hills (sometimes used figuratively)
safe, i.e. (figuratively) well, happy, friendly; also (abstractly) welfare, i.e. health, prosperity, peace
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
rightness (abstractly), subjectively (rectitude), objectively (justice), morally (virtue) or figuratively (prosperity)

4.brief: to judge, i.e. pronounce sentence (for or against); by implication, to vindicate or punish; by extenssion, to govern; passively, to litigate (literally or figuratively)
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
properly, to be open, wide or free, i.e. (by implication) to be safe; causatively, to free or succor
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
to crumble; transitively, to bruise (literally or figuratively)
to press upon, i.e. oppress, defraud, violate, overflow

5.brief: to fear; morally, to revere; caus. to frighten
adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)
the sun; by implication, the east; figuratively, a ray, i.e. (architectural) a notched battlement
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
properly, a revolution of time, i.e. an age or generation; also a dwelling
properly, a revolution of time, i.e. an age or generation; also a dwelling

6.brief: to descend (literally, to go downwards; or conventionally to a lower region, as the shore, a boundary, the enemy, etc.; or figuratively, to fall); causatively, to bring down (in all the above applications)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a fleece (as shorn); also mown grass
a rain (as an accumulation of drops)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)

7.brief: to break forth as a bud, i.e. bloom; generally, to spread; specifically, to fly (as extending the wings); figuratively, to flourish
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
safe, i.e. (figuratively) well, happy, friendly; also (abstractly) welfare, i.e. health, prosperity, peace
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
properly, failure, i.e. nothing or destruction; usually (with preposition) without, not yet, because not, as long as, etc.

8.brief: to tread down, i.e. subjugate; specifically, to crumble off

a sea (as breaking in noisy surf) or large body of water; specifically (with the article), the Mediterranean Sea; sometimes a large river, or an artifical basin; locally, the west, or (rarely) the south
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)

a sea (as breaking in noisy surf) or large body of water; specifically (with the article), the Mediterranean Sea; sometimes a large river, or an artifical basin; locally, the west, or (rarely) the south
a stream (including the sea; expectation the Nile, Euphrates, etc.); figuratively, prosperity
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
cessation, i.e. an end (especially of the earth); often used adverb, no further; also the ankle (in the dual), as being the extremity of the leg or foot
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)

9.brief: the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
to bend the knee; by implication, to sink, to prostrate
a desert-dweller, i.e. nomad or wild beast
dust (as powdered or gray); hence, clay, earth, mud

10.brief: Tarshish, a place on the Mediterranean, hence, the ephithet of a merchant vessel (as if for or from that port); also the name of a Persian and of an Israelite
properly, a habitable spot (as desirable); dry land, a coast, an island
a donation; euphemistically, tribute; specifically a sacrificial offering (usually bloodless and voluntary)
to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again
Sheba, the name of three early progenitors of tribes and of an Ethiopian district
Seba, a son of Cush, and the country settled by him
to approach (causatively, bring near) for whatever purpose

11.brief: to depress, i.e. prostrate (especially reflexive, in homage to royalty or God)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a foreign nation; hence, a Gentile; also (figuratively) a troop of animals, or a flight of locusts
to work (in any sense); by implication, to serve, till, (causatively) enslave, etc.

12.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to snatch away, whether in a good or a bad sense
properly, to be free; but used only causatively and reflexively, to halloo (for help, i.e. freedom from some trouble)
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
to surround, i.e. protect or aid

13.brief: properly, to cover, i.e. (figuratively) to compassionate
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, dangling, i.e. (by implication) weak or thin
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
properly, to be open, wide or free, i.e. (by implication) to be safe; causatively, to free or succor

14.brief: violence; by implication, wrong; by meton. unjust gain
to be the next of kin (and as such to buy back a relative's property, marry his widow, etc.)
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
properly, apparently, to be heavy, i.e. (figuratively) valuable; causatively, to make rare (figuratively, to inhibit)
blood (as that which when shed causes death) of man or an animal; by analogy, the juice of the grape; figuratively (especially in the plural) bloodshed (i.e. drops of blood)
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)

15.brief: to live, whether literally or figuratively; causatively, to revive
to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
gold, figuratively, something gold-colored (i.e. yellow), as oil, a clear sky
Sheba, the name of three early progenitors of tribes and of an Ethiopian district
to judge (officially or mentally); by extension, to intercede, pray
in up to or over against; generally at, beside, among, behind, for, etc.
properly, continuance (as indefinite extension); but used only (attributively as adjective) constant (or adverbially, constantly); ellipt. the regular (daily) sacrifice
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
to kneel; by implication to bless God (as an act of adoration), and (vice-versa) man (as a benefit); also (by euphemism) to curse (God or the king, as treason)

16.brief: to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
grain of any kind (even while standing in the field); by extension the open country
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
the head (as most easily shaken), whether literal or figurative (in many applications, of place, time, rank, itc.)
a mountain or range of hills (sometimes used figuratively)
to undulate (as the earth, the sky, etc.; also a field of grain), particularly through fear; specifically, to spring (as a locust)
Lebanon, a mountain range in Palestine
to twinkle, i.e. glance; by analogy, to blossom (figuratively, flourish)
a city (a place guarded by waking or a watch) in the widest sense (even of a mere encampment or post)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)

17.brief: to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character
properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
the sun; by implication, the east; figuratively, a ray, i.e. (architectural) a notched battlement
to resprout, i.e. propagate by shoots; figuratively, to be perpetual
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character
to kneel; by implication to bless God (as an act of adoration), and (vice-versa) man (as a benefit); also (by euphemism) to curse (God or the king, as treason)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a foreign nation; hence, a Gentile; also (figuratively) a troop of animals, or a flight of locusts
to be straight (used in the widest sense, especially to be level, right, happy); figuratively, to go forward, be honest, proper

18.brief: to kneel; by implication to bless God (as an act of adoration), and (vice-versa) man (as a benefit); also (by euphemism) to curse (God or the king, as treason)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
properly, perhaps to separate, i.e. distinguish (literally or figuratively); by implication, to be (causatively, make) great, difficult, wonderful
properly, separation; by implication, a part of the body, branch of atree, bar forcarrying; figuratively, chief of a city; especially (with prepositional prefix) as an adverb, apart, only, besides

19.brief: to kneel; by implication to bless God (as an act of adoration), and (vice-versa) man (as a benefit); also (by euphemism) to curse (God or the king, as treason)
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character
properly, weight, but only figuratively in a good sense, splendor or copiousness
properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always
to fill or (intransitively) be full of, in a wide application (literally and figuratively)
properly, weight, but only figuratively in a good sense, splendor or copiousness
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)

20.brief: to end, whether intransitive (to cease, be finished, perish) or transitived (to complete, prepare, consume)
intercession, supplication; by implication, a hymn
David, the youngest son of Jesse
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
